reviews.text: One things I was looking forward to on holiday was a good night's sleep! -Not really an option for me at this hotel. The pictures make it look like it is right on the Marina-infact, there is a fairly busy road which separates the hotel from the Marina. The double glazing in our room did not cut out the noise from outside. One morning I woke at around 5am to the sound of a street cleaning machine which went on for ages. In addition to this there was the sound of clattering cutlery and plates from the breakfast room which could be heard each morning in our first floor room. The music from reception which seemed to be fairly constant, could also be heard (albeit fairly faintly) floating through the air vents of our room. We were directly above the lobby and also near the lift and I was frequently woken by the conversations and comings and goings of other hotel stayers.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those interested in using the swimming pool, I would warn you that it is not very big. I would go so far as to mention 'postage stamp' -you coudn't comfortably fit more than two swimmers in it at the same time and it's not a full length size. Having said that, hours of the pool were good and there is also lots of sunbathing areas on the roof.
reviews.title: What a nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a good selection of food at breakfast. The free internet access was useful. The location of the hotel was convenient for the railway station, bus station, restaurants, cash point, small supermarket, petrol station(particularly useful for latenight bottled water supplies) and the town centre. Meia Praia (good beach!) a 5-10 minute walk away.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC ALL ROUNDER!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, (perhaps the weak pound plays its part in this), I did not feel that this hotel was value for money. Although the location was good, the room and pool were too small and it was far too noisy for me!!!
reviews.title: Very good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were staying for one week at this hotel and we were very pleased with the Hotel, Staff, Breakfast (partly continental and partly English), Surroundings were brilliant with the marina just outside the door and the Old town just a short walk away.
reviews.title: Ideal in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in July 2010.
reviews.title: Loved our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: excellent, about a 10 minute walk to Meia Praia. Also a 10 minute walk to the main area with restaurants/shopping. The bus stop is behind the hotel so very convenient if you’re coming/going to Albufeira or Lisbon.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beaches: The hotel has a shuttle to Meia Praia and Dona Ana. We preferred walking to Meia Praia instead of taking the shuttle because we preferred the stretch of beach closer to the walk than further down the beach where the hotel drops you off (the hotel drop off is a nicely paved path, if you walk it’s just hills of grass/sands). Dona Ana was closed when we were there, so we went to the beach next to it (Camilo), which is just as picturesque. Although Camilo is beautiful with coves, etc., I still prefer Meia preia, the sand is cleaner, the water was cleaner, and it’s just such a glorious stretch of beach.
reviews.title: Great harbour view room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Suggestions: Lagos is really touristy, so it was hard to find decent food. The only restaurant we really enjoyed was A Barrigada. You can choose your fish, and it comes with potatoes, salad, bread, etc. The fig and almond desert was tasty too. A local recommended it. We were the only tourists eating there, so I guess that says something. It’s about a 10-15 mintue walk from the hotel, past Meia Praia. One of the better meals we had in Portugal, simple, but well made, fresh, and tasty.
reviews.title: It only gets better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms/amenities: the room was lovely, spacious, clean. Breakfast was fine, they have croissants so I’d make a croissant sandwich out of cold-cuts each morning, yum. I was concerned about the noise because of previous posts, we booked had a marina room facing the street, and the noise was not an issue at all. I’m a very light sleeper, and was shocked to find out how quiet it was. We had the sliding door closed since we had A/C in the evening. I’d definitely only stay in a marina room, the rooms facing the bus stop look like they’d be noisy/smell/terrible views.
reviews.title: We Were Extremely Lucky To Find This Place

reviews.text: Only stayed here for one night enroute to Faro but a nice hotel in a lovely little town.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel for short stay

reviews.text: They were good enough to do me an early Sunday morning breakfast so that I could get to the airport on time.
reviews.title: Super Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shame I didnt find out about the rooftop pool until I was on my way home, should have looked at these reviews first perhaps!!
reviews.title: lovely friendly hotel in excellent position
Lovely hotel, highly recommended
reviews.text: An extremely nice hotel with superb location, especially with marina view. Well worth the money even if just a fairly simple breakfast is included.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the marina rio for 2 weeks in november 2009. The weather was warm and sunny. We stayed at the front of the hotel overlooking the marina. The view is stunning and well worth the extra euros. Everything at the hotel has been freshly decorated and is as ever spotless clean. Breakfasts were a real treat, a mixture of continental and english, coffee machine produced vast range of coffees to suit all tastes.Staff are very helpful and friendly. I look forward to going back again soon.
reviews.title: Lovely small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was recommended on Trip Advisor and it lived up to its promises. The location is excellent. It's directly opposite the Marina and a very short walk into the Old Town. We were exceptionally impressed with the cleanliness. The public areas and the bedroom were spotless. The breakfast was also very good. There was plenty of choice and, as it was all self service, there was no waiting around for that extra cup of coffee. We had a room without a view ( overlooking the bus station) but we didn't smell any diesel fumes and the best bit about a room on that side is that it gets the sun until well into the evening. If you don't mind the shade and prefer overlooking the very attractive Marina, opt for the other side. There are only 36 rooms and each has a spacious balcony. In addition, there's a lovely sun-deck and plunge pool on the roof. There is internet access and if you forget a book, there is a little little library for you to leave or swap books.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money and a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's so easy to walk along the promenade to the cliffside walk and there's a fair bit to see in the Old Town. At the moment there is a lot of building work going on in the public square area but I bet it will be wonderful when it is finished. This is our third visit to the Algarve and Lagos beats the previous resorts by miles. I do think, however, that it is better suited to people who like a quieter time and who enjoy watching the world go by in cafes and restaurants.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel overlooking the marina

likes.disliked: — Small towels and occasionally not enough hot water for a shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Quailty of Service

likes.disliked: — 2 single beds into 1 double (lets have a proper double bed)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at the Marina Rio on Christmas Day 2008 and was pleasantly suprised, the reception area was very clean and freshly painted, the receptionist was very pleasant and spoke good English, our room 112 was on the first floor just a few steps up the central staircase or there is a lift, was beautiful, very tastefully decorated with air conditioning which also had very good heating for the winter, the bathroom also had a heater and was very clean.the breakfast room was very bright and airey overlooking the marina there was a good variety every day of either continental breakfast or bacon and eggs,cereals,fruit, yoghurts,rolls etc, something for everyone.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a small computer area, a bar, television area and a swimming pool on the roof terrace but that was closed due to renovation work .
reviews.title: Great Hotel! Great Location!
